reviewText:
Where to begin?  Very few games give me a headache when playing them.  This is one of those games.

This game really needs someone with incredible patience to create a video walkthru just to explain how to play this crazy game.   So far no one has done this.  Not sure anyone will.  I'm sure as hell not going to try.  I didn't even get through what I think was the tutorial before giving up in frustration.

I got to a wall where it said hold W to climb wall.  Uh no.  That doesn't work.  Not at all.  You have to use a combination of hitting W and the space bar in the right way to get up that wall.  And that is provided you didn't waste energy sprinting around and stuff.

The game doesn't bother to tell you that sprinting or using your jet pack" consumes energy.  And if you consume too much energy
date: then you cannot get past the next obstacle.  Too bad.  What to do?  Hit X and autodestruct and start over.  My first attempt I did just that in trying to get over that stupid wall
recommended: where I didn't have enough jet pack whatever to get me high enough.  Except I didn't know to hit X
hoursPlayed: until I accidentally hit in randomly hitting keys on the keyboard.  There is a way to get a list of the controls
voteText: including the magic use of X
helpfulPercent: but it's not obvious why you would want to autodestruct
votesHelpful: so it's easy to overlook.\n\nAfter the wall
votesTotal: I got to a switch of some kind.  I tried everything
votesFunny: but I could not figure out for the life of me how to flip that freaking switch.  It's probably some use of the E button with the cursor positioned just so
column16: maybe not.  After futzing with it for a few minutes
column17: I decided I no longer cared to play this game.  It was giving me a headache.  And not the fun kind of a headache either.  If such a thing exists.  No.  This is get an aspirin and not ever play the game again kind of headache.\n\nThis game might be playable
column18: or possibly in some alternate universe
column20: if you had any idea of what you were doing half the time.\n\nThe game boasts that it is the hardest sci-fi side scroller.  Ever.  Yeah right.  Having a game where not enough time was taken on basic stuff
column21: like spelling or creating a descent tutorial
column25: "frustrating to the point where you don't want to play it anymore".\n\nAs a side note
column26: it's kind of amazing really how bad the spelling is at times.  Instead of the word "destroy"
column27: you have "destrov".  Instead of the world "following" you have "follawing" and so on.   But I digrees and I'm getting yet another headache even thinking about all this."

reviewText: This is a game with a message, and the message is BEWARE!. This is not a game for playing -- this is a game for uninstalling and avoiding. This game is only for those keen on regurgitation. I think – no, I’m positive - that this is the most unattractive game I have ever played in my entire life. You know, in the short time I played this, this game demonstrated every loathsome characteristic of bad game design and even discovered a few new ones. It is visually repulsive, and intellectually ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Charging money for this is morally reprehensible, vulgar, insensitive, selfish, and stupid. The game has no purpose, a lousy sense of functionality and is broken in every sense of the word. I played Busby 3D, one of the worst platformers ever made, CortexGear:AngryDroids makes Busby 3D better, more enjoyable by just existing and lowering the bar.

reviewText: This game is very bad. I believe that I got it for free, but even at that price I would strongly advise against getting it. The developer's claim that this game is the hardest sci-fi shooting side scroller ever" is certainly true. In fact
date:
it is so hard that it is unplayable.

Graphics: Terrible. The game is in windowed mode and takes up about 1/3 of the screen which is useless. The resolutions are bizarre and nonstandard. The background is patchy and looks like a game being run on windows 95. It's so badly optimized that it lags dreadfully even though it's a side scroller with essentially one moving part.

Gameplay: I think I got stuck somewhere during the tutorial section of the game. Certainly there were parts which seemed like tutorial
recommended: but it was still incredibly difficult to glean any instructions from what was on screen. At one point I had to hack a computer. It told me to press "pause
voteText:
info" to know how to hack a computer. When I did this it simply said "melee attack can turn on the rage mode". This didn't seem very useful so I tried to work it out myself for a minute or two before giving up and coming to write this review.

Story: N/A. The only fragment of story I got was a strange voice during the load up screen saying "I will destroy you". One of many background voices that seemed to bear no relevance to anything within the game. I had a mission at one point "Destroy every droids in the ruin". Just one of the many grammatical/spelling errors within the game.

Sound: As mentioned before there were weird voices/sounds popping up in the background with no discernible purpose.

Overall
column16: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is hell, and if I had any say in it, would be removed from Steam. It is truly, utterly, and completely awful.
This game starts with you looking at a list of instructions. These instructions are not for what you are doing now. They are for what you WILL be doing. There are also several dozen spelling problems.
For the first several seconds after loading, the screen will flash in a headache-inducing manner.
If you manage to think to look behind you, you will find the main menu, where you can start the game. Maybe. If you can figure out how. The 'start' button seems to allow you to choose which save file you are using. It does not, in fact, start the freaking game.
From what I can tell, the 'Alpha Simulation' button is what starts the game.
The first time I managed to actually start the game, my character fell for a few seconds, died, then exploded. Then the game froze because it doesn't seem to understand how to handle the character dying. Though I'm not exactly sure what the heck I did to start the game in the first place, because I didn't use the 'alpha simulation' button, but instead clicked around for two minutes in utter confusion before it began for some reason.
The second time I got it working, I did use the 'alpha simulation' button, which brought me to a long, very gray area with lots of boxes. There was a wall on the left, a wall fairly distant to the right, a few platforms, and a green thing in the middle. It told me to press F, and after I stood precisely on top of the green thing, it did... something. I'm not sure. It made a little green pillar thingy. I'm still not sure what it is.
Then, background things started moving around. I moved around some more and found nothing of interest to interact with. I tried attacking the green thing, to no avail. I noticed the top right corner told me to press m. I pressed m, and saw an overview of the level and found I had the ability to spawn things in. Now I'm getting somewhere! A weapon, another droid thing... Some ammo... Some... Well, not much, actually. Basically nothing of use. I picked up the weapon, and shot the other droid because I think it attacked me (I honestly can't say for sure).
Then, I kinda jumped around and waited and wondered what in the world is going on. Nothing seemed to actually be happening.
This continued for a while as what looked to be some kind of city approached from the background and connected itself to the boring gray box I'd been stuck in. Unfortunately, I had no idea whatsoever as to how in the world I was supposed to handle this new dimension. After attacking the green thingy some and jumping around a lot, I closed the game so I could look at the controls again. The controls did not help. I fruitlessly started the alpha simulation once more before I just gave up because THIS GAME IS USELESS. I HATE IT. I HATE IT MORE THAN ANYTHING.
I SPENT ELEVEN MINUTES OF MY LIFE ON THIS USELESS PIECE OF TRASH AND I WANT THEM BACK.
Edit: I forgot to mention one of the other 'features' in this useless thing. If you happen to press the wrong button (it's either x or c, I'm not sure), your character gives up on life and self destructs, which will always cause the game to freeze. Enjoy.

reviewText: CortexGear:AngryDroids has a ridiculous menu with multiple options and it flashes continuously.
